revised_title: High Pressure Neurological Syndrome and its Effects on the Central Nervous System
tldr: This article discusses the high pressure neurological syndrome (h.p.n.s.), a complex of behavioral changes observed in vertebrates when exposed to increasing pressures. The author explores the effects of hydrostatic pressure on the central nervous system, the mechanisms of adaptation and acclimation to high pressure, and the potential for genetic factors in the evolution of deep-sea animals. The article also examines the relationship between pressure and temperature in affecting biological processes and the potential for pressure acclimation in mammals.
